review_title: Keep Looking for a better job
job_title: Rad Technologist in Little River, SC
pros: The people are great to work with
cons: Admin is a joke and love themselves

review_title: Not a difficult job, but expect to be overworked and stressed out.
pros: Co-workers were easy to get along with. The job itself is pretty simple. Pay is pretty good for what you do. Bonuses are given out for being noticed as a good/hard worker. You can use your badge at the cafeteria/stores in the hospital, which is deducted from your pay.
cons: The “bonus” you’ll receive is a free lunch card. While it is appreciated, it isn’t enough for the work you have to do to receive one. Floor Technicians are very understaffed. Expect to be overworked every day. Management in the EVS department were aloof, out of touch and disorganized. Supervisors will literally follow you around (even after saying they won’t do that in front of management). Supervisors will tell you one thing while the Assistant Director and Director will tell you something else. Very confusing and frustrating! Training was inadequate and you’ll be expected to do things you were never trained for and expected to do it well. You’re constantly on-call and if someone calls out, expect to do their work AND yours plus whatever calls you have to respond to. Then you’ll be admonished for not being able to finish your work while you’re doing other peoples work AND having to field calls all day. VERY disorganized! Other EVS techs will refuse to field certain calls or do part of their job and you’ll be expected to do it, despite your work load without any action from management. Management doesn’t want to get rid of people because so many have already gotten fed up and left so the workers don’t care and slack off and management doesn’t do anything about it as they don’t want to fire anybody. Insurance is high.

pros: Coworkers are great, don’t have people breathing down your neck

pros:
- Team playing coworkers, unit dependent. 
- Annual competencies to keep up with CE
- When passing in the hallways, everyone is typically pleasant 
- Clean working environment
- Discounts to many places in surrounding area
- Overall good culture and has amazing values they try to uphold
- Personally like that every patient is accepted for care, regardless of insurance or lack there of.
- Room to grow and branch out into different areas (if not blocked by management). 
- Diverse coworkers
cons:
-Management does not care about current staff. They are willing to stay in their office and point fingers rather than listen. 
-Bullying is acceptable from team, as well as upper management.
-Rather would keep travelers and pay them the big bucks than pay current staff. 
- Not many incentives to "work more" to help with short staffing issues.
- Management play favoritism as to who is allowed to get pay incentives available, no clear policy-unit and director specific.
- Management expects staff to go above and beyond to work on days off rather than come in and work themselves when there is poor staffing,

pros: McLeod truly was a great way to get my foot in the door. It’s a good organization and is a good place to be if you want to be somewhere stable for a long period of time.
cons: No overtime was allowed. Work load was far more than compensation. Turnover rate high.

review_title: Look elsewhere! The values and missions are a statement on the wall.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Little River, SC
pros: None… other than being married to your job, dodging bullets, zero breaks, no raise, work the hard and you will be used, abused and expected to work harder. If you see that as a great work environment…welcome. It’s a revolving door.
cons:
If you want a life outside? Do not work here. 
If you left drama, gossip, catty, jealousy and vindictiveness in middle school? Do not work here. 
If you want to work like a dog and be talked to by other coworkers like one? Do not work here.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner, Board Certified in Manning, SC
pros:
The ancillary staff can be great and the location. Some managers lift up and encourage their staff daily
The physicians are great especially Dr. Barrineau our surgeon and other specialties, there is a new NP with orthopedics that may patients loved and he was awesome
cons:
Certain Manager are in positions they have no experience in. 
They do not like when someone points out mistakes and flaws in the process or system and will not attempt to correct or discuss the issues. 
The underhanded way they terminate people is to try and humiliate them rather than being professional, and then basically treat you with no respect when you are gathering your things to leave and you are not allowed to pack up your own belongings if you don't get them the same day they come in a spring your termination on you
My advice is to always have empty boxes at the ready to pack up your things 
Albeit they were correct in pointing out my flaws and I admit to them.

job_title: Famiy Nurse Practitioner in Charleston, SC

cons: This organization does not  appear to respect or appreciate " midlevel providers" ---most notifications and paperwork refers to "doctor" as opposed to "providers".  The organization advertises for their doctors but does not give nurse practitioner the same advertisement.

pros: Decent benefits, good coworkers. It's good to have your foot in the door since McLeod is buying up everything
cons: Pay is terrible for the work required. Number of patients assigned to each tech is overwhelming on a good day. Lack of equipment doesn't help matters. Micromanagement needs to stop. Lunch? If you're lucky, and don't expect to get your full 30 minutes most days.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Little River, SC
pros:
Best pay around the area, but still less than national average.
Overtime available if wanted.  Growing with opportunities for advancement.  New facility, clean, pretty.  Interesting flow for visitors. Separate from staff entry.
cons: As they are growing, there are growing pains.  Still learning how to best be efficient. Not attracting renowned providers (at that time anyhow). Staffing is a challenge as the census can fluctuate drastically in a relatively short amount of time.

review_title: My co workers at Mcleod treated me like family until I was charged w/a crime, then I wasn't good enough to work there.
pros: Treated me like family, great benefits, growing successful business, up to date technology.
cons: Co workers very judgmental, very difficult to obtain employment  unless you know someone,  those that have made mistakes which lead to criminal charges(white collar) are discriminated against by Human Resources, unwilling to cooperate with dhec guidelines for felons. All who have felonies are labeled as not hire able .

review_title: Great benefits with subpar medical quality!
job_title: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner in Dillon, SC
pros: Salary. Benefits. Working with lazy people who don't care what you do
cons: Lazy doctors, ignorant patients, unresponsive management. Being recruited to move from Arizona to South Carolina for a high quality job and working at a low quality clinic, alone, in a poor, dangerous rural (DILLON) area of South Carolina.

review_title: McLeod Health has a vision of "Growth through Excellent Service" that resonates throughout the organization.
pros: The people I have the privilege of working with make coming to work stimulating and fun!  There is always something new to learn.
cons: We have a healthy culture focused on Caring, the Person, Quality, Integrity.  No workplace is perfect, but many challenges are tolerable when you as an employee feels that your work team cares about you.

pros: Coworkers and patients are the only pros. Nothing about McLeod Health is a pro otherwise.
cons: Management promotes a sneaky atmosphere of spying on employees, firing those who complain and being spiteful to any employee who disagrees with policy or speaks up about problems within the facility.

job_title: Former Entry Level Employee in Florence, SC
pros: the crew was wounderful. the work was easy. the teamwork was phenomenal. we were treated like professionals always. our input was carefully considered. flexible hours and good pto. I learned a lot working here.

pros: So I can come in contact with people to allow them to understand life a little better so when it's all over they can look back and see the impact I put on them
cons: You will run across people who think you are out to get them, you will see things that will make you look at life a little different

pros: Was biggest mistake of my life to work here ever read cons. This was just Oct 2018 be warned they are shady and dishonest and do not answer. I tried to resolve multiple times to get dates right but HR WILL NOT CALL YOU BACK AND WILL NOT MAKE IT RIGHT WHEN THEY WRONG YOU. Even tried main HR in Florence and guess what no response. You mean squat to them
cons: For a honest company they screwed me in the end. First they say oops we r paying you to much and reduce my wages which mind you is why I left other job, then I left and worked notice but mgr forgot to put in status change they continued my insurance past when it was supposed to end and garnished my last check for it. Worked 4 hrs last check got pd 1 dollar. Then 401k paid out was below 1000. Out of 955.37 they took 380.44 as a forfeiture after they said it had to b cashed out. Minus also govt taxes besides that. Bottom line out of 955.37 I received 436.94 so b weary of their 401k.

pros: Biggest employer in town. Offer PTO, and benefits. The 401k program they use is great. They also offer a company match.

review_title: Great place to work, great place for care

cons: Growing pains, but size and growth brings strength. Encourage continued investment in training and development to allow career growth, advancement and reward motivated staff.

review_title: Avoid if looking for long term employment
job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Charlotte, NC
pros: Gaining experience working with clients with active substance abuse problems.
cons: Extensive paperwork. Job was dedicated to working entirely with combative clients and the hours (5am-12pm) were grueling. Not much actual therapy was being done. Rapid turnover.
